responses: Anyone passionate about coding, development, and software creation can join CDSC! Whether you're a beginner or experienced developer, we welcome everyone eager to learn and contribute.
Great question! CDSC is open to all students who have an interest in coding and software development. No prior experience is required - just enthusiasm to learn!
Anyone with a passion for coding and development can join CDSC! Beginners and experienced developers are all welcome.
CDSC membership is open to all students interested in coding and software â€” no prior experience needed, just enthusiasm to learn and contribute.

responses: To register for events, visit the Events section on our website or follow the registration link shared on our social media platforms. Fill out the required details and you'll receive a confirmation email.
Event registration is simple! Check our website's Events section or look for registration links on our Instagram and LinkedIn pages. Just fill out the form and you're all set!
To register, check the Events section on our website or follow links on Instagram @cbitdsc and LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club. Once you fill the form, you'll receive a confirmation email.
Registration is simple just use the links shared on Instagram @cbitdsc and LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club to sign up.

patterns: Do I need to pay for events?
responses: Event cost details are always mentioned in the event description. Most of our workshops and sessions are free for members, but some specialized events may have minimal fees. Check the specific event page for pricing information.
Most CDSC workshops and sessions are free, while some special events may have minimal fees. Please check the specific event page for details.

patterns: Are there collaborations with other clubs?
Do you work with other clubs?
responses: Yes! We frequently collaborate with other clubs to bring you joint workshops, hackathons, and more. Check our social media platforms for upcoming collaborative events.
Absolutely! CDSC regularly partners with other technical clubs and societies for hackathons, workshops, and coding competitions. Follow us on social media to stay updated!
Yes! CDSC collaborates with other clubs for workshops, hackathons, and tech events. Find updates on Instagram @cbitdsc and LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club.
We partner with technical groups and organizations for events and projects. Keep an eye on Instagram @cbitdsc and LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club for updates.

patterns: What are the social media handles?
responses: Follow us for updates! Instagram: @cbitdsc, LinkedIn: CBIT Developer Student Club. We post regular updates about events, workshops, and opportunities!
Follow us on Instagram @cbitdsc and LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club for all the latest updates, events, and workshops.
Yes, we do! Check out our projects and contributions on our official GitHub organization. You can find collaborative projects, member contributions, and open-source initiatives there!
Yes! Our GitHub organization hosts open-source projects, member contributions, and collaborative work. Check it out to explore and contribute.

patterns: How do I talk to you?
responses: You can reach out to us through our social media channels or email us at cbitdsc@gmail.com. Our team is always happy to help with any questions or suggestions!
You can reach us anytime via Instagram @cbitdsc, LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club, or by email at cbitdsc@gmail.com.
We organize various events including coding workshops, hackathons, tech talks, project showcases, and collaborative sessions with other clubs. Stay tuned to our announcements for more details!
We organize coding workshops, hackathons, tech talks, project showcases, and collaborations. For updates, follow Instagram @cbitdsc and LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club.

patterns: What projects is the club working on?
responses: We're always working on exciting projects! From web applications to mobile apps, AI/ML projects to competitive programming solutions. Check our GitHub for current projects and join us to contribute!
We're working on web apps, mobile apps, and AI/ML projects. You can view and contribute to them on our GitHub.
We absolutely value your suggestions and feedback! You can reach out to us via our social media channels, email, or speak to any club member. Your ideas help us improve and grow!
We'd love your feedback! Share ideas with us via Instagram @cbitdsc, LinkedIn CBIT Developer Student Club, or email us at cbitdsc@gmail.com.
VibeathonX will be held on October 17-18 at Assembly Hall, CBIT, featuring a 24-hour hackathon and expert-led tech talks.
On October 17-18, Assembly Hall CBIT will host VibeathonX with a mix of industry talks and an exciting 24-hour hackathon.
Mark your calendars: VibeathonX at Assembly Hall, CBIT, October 17-18 - a full program of hackathon challenges and technology discussions.
